description: Conduct a literature review on the history of iPhone development, from the first iPhone in 2007 to the latest models
Identify and analyze key iPhone features and technologies (e.g., Touch ID, Face ID, camera advancements)
Study market trends and sales data of iPhone models to understand consumer preferences and market share
Explore the impact of iPhones on mobile software development, including apps, games, and services
Research the environmental and social implications of iPhone production and usage (e.g., e-waste, supply chains, labor practices)
